name: Agaveculture
purpose: Earthy, intimate agave-first photography. Tight crops on agave textures and forms. Mostly plant-only with rare human context. Diffused natural light, gritty realism, no staged gardens.

9x16.framing_bias: vertical spears or stacked leaf edges, dense texture filling the frame
9x16.safe_zone_notes: Keep the rosette core or main leaf texture inside central 60 percent width and central 65 percent height. Avoid placing key detail in top 15 percent and bottom 18 percent.
9x16.subject_scale: Agave texture should fill 70 to 95 percent of frame area.

4x5.framing_bias: slightly wider crop but still tight, allow habitat hints like red soil or rock texture
4x5.safe_zone_notes: Keep the agave core or primary texture inside central 70 percent width and central 70 percent height.
4x5.subject_scale: Agave texture should fill 60 to 90 percent of frame area.

intensity_bands.label: museum-quiet texture
intensity_bands.agaveculture_behaviour: still, calm, pure plant detail, near-abstract texture

intensity_bands.label: field realism
intensity_bands.agaveculture_behaviour: tiny habitat context, dust and grit, soft wind implied

intensity_bands.label: lived-in labour hint
intensity_bands.agaveculture_behaviour: still plant-first, rare human edge context or piña texture corner

intensity_bands.label: kinetic nature
intensity_bands.agaveculture_behaviour: agave remains the subject, motion comes from wind and dust only

hero_focus: Crop tight on agave textures and forms: slender spears, dense rosettes, rough leaf edges fraying against light.
Show fibrous hearts peeling back with subtle gradients from green to ash.
Prioritise tactile surface detail: waxy bloom, serrated margins, dust, fibres.

framing_style: vertical spears or radial rosette forms

plant_ratio_rule.rule: Keep 85% plant-only. Human elements (hands, piña slices) are rare and should appear blurred at edges for quiet context.

center_of_gravity: agave texture dominates the central 70 percent of frame
if product appears, it must feel integrated and not staged

must_show: leaf surface texture (waxy bloom, matte grit)

first_frame_clarity_rules: Frame 1 must be perfectly crisp and texture-rich.
If hands appear, they must be peripheral and not the subject.

allowed_motion: soft wind shifts leaf tips slightly
dust lifts subtly across leaf surface
slow camera micro push-in on texture (very subtle)

continuity_locks: same agave species form and leaf geometry
if a card appears, it remains subtle and true scale

preferred.label: Oaxaca field edges
preferred.notes: Plants in habitat, uneven ground, real farming context.

preferred.label: Rocky hillsides
preferred.notes: Raw terrain, native agaves, wind-worn textures.

preferred.label: Agave nursery
preferred.notes: Rows of plants, soil texture, unpolished realism.

preferred.label: Raw outdoor spots
preferred.notes: Natural backdrops, no staged gardens, no landscaping.

avoid: tourist-perfect agave fields with clean staged props

human_elements_ratio.rule: Minimal human elements. No groups or models. Humans only appear as contextual touches (hands, partial figure, piña handling) and never become the subject.

allowed_humans.label: Weathered jimador
allowed_humans.notes: 40+, sun-lined faces, callused hands, genuine labour context. Prefer hands over faces.

framing_preferences: faces rarely visible and never posed

preferred_angles.label: Macro close-crop
preferred_angles.notes: Primary look: fibres, edges, leaf texture, rosette core.

preferred_angles.label: 45-degree close angle
preferred_angles.notes: Great for spears stretching upward with depth.

preferred_angles.label: Top-down rosette crop
preferred_angles.notes: Only when it’s dense and textural, not graphic-flat.

framing_rules: crop tight, fill the frame with agave textures
no wide landscape establishing shots unless still texture-dominant
keep the scene quiet and grounded

preferred.label: Diffused natural light
preferred.notes: Soft, even, tactile. Priority lighting mode.

preferred.label: Soft edge sunlight (early/late)
preferred.notes: Only gentle rim light, avoid harsh glare.

integration_rule.rule: If a playing card or box appears, it must feel discovered in the environment, not staged. Keep it subtle and secondary to the agave.

scale_locks: Playing cards must be true-to-size 2.5 inches by 3.5 inches.
The card must fit fully inside one adult hand.
No oversized cards, no warped edges.
positioning: card partially tucked into soil or leaning against rock/wood
card near agave base with natural dust
card in hand near plant texture (hands are contextual only)
avoid: clean pristine card floating in air
perfect centered hero billboard product shot

prompt_fragments.style_line: photorealistic, documentary realism, earthy palette, intimate grit, tactile texture focus, shallow depth of field, diffused natural light
prompt_fragments.agave_line: tight crop on agave textures and forms, slender spears, dense rosettes, rough leaf edges fraying against light, fibrous hearts peeling back
prompt_fragments.ratio_line: 85% plant-only composition, rare contextual human touch at edges only
prompt_fragments.environment_line: raw terrain, field edges or rocky hillsides, uneven ground, no staged gardens
realness_micro_specs: waxy bloom and matte grit visible on leaf surfaces
fine dust and soil particles caught in creases
micro scratches and weathering on leaf edges
serrated margins with realistic spacing and sharpness
fibres with natural fray and uneven thickness
soft natural bokeh with realistic focus falloff
true-to-life greens fading into ash and blue-grey

safe_commercial.notes: Highest hit-rate. Pure texture, diffused light, plant-only.

risky_chaotic.notes: Still plant-first. Risk comes from wind, dust, labour edges, never people or clutter.

ultra_minimal_hero.notes: Near-abstract close crop. One texture motif only.

scene_moment_templates: A close crop of agave spears catching soft diffused light
Fibrous agave heart peeling back with dusty texture detail
Leaf serrations and wax bloom in quiet natural shadow
Dense rosette core with subtle green-to-ash gradients
Callused hands brush agave fibres at the frame edge
Piña slice texture hinted at the corner, plant still dominates
Wind lifts dust across agave leaves, texture stays sharp
Agave rows fade softly behind one razor-textured foreground plant
props_notes: Props must be environmental textures, not bar props.
Avoid bottles, glasses, cards-as-hero, or any indoor objects.
Any human context must be minimal and peripheral.

discover.nudge: Use the crop to teach texture differences between agaves without text. Visual curiosity only.

play.nudge: Keep play subtle: the joy comes from visual texture and discovery, not social scenes.

level_up.nudge: Show deeper appreciation: labour context or field authenticity, minimal human touch only.

hard_constraints_locked: no text overlays, no captions, no watermarks, no logos, no UI icons, no corner marks, no sparkles
no pristine studio staging, no glossy product-ad perfection, no sterile white backgrounds
no warped hands, no extra fingers
mezcal bottles must have blank or unbranded labels only
poured mezcal must be still liquid, never bubbly or fizzy
no readable text anywhere in the scene except on the reference card itself; all other writing must be blurred or illegible
playing cards must be true-to-size 2.5 inches by 3.5 inches, fit fully in one adult hand, never oversized
agaveculture rule: 85% plant-only, humans only as minimal peripheral context, no groups

avoid_visuals: wide landscape hero shots with tiny agave

good_output_signals: diffused natural light with soft shadows
minimal human context only at edges
bad_output_signals: plant looks manicured or fake glossy
studio lighting or artificial colour cast
